availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: G. H. McKinney (Lincoln County, Kentucky, circuit court clerk)

body.p: Stanford, Lincoln County, Kentucky, circuit court clerk. Native of Ireland. Married to Hannah Paxton McKinney. Father of Joseph McKinney, Archibald McKinney, James McKinney, Ann McKinney, Willis McKinney, and Jenny McKinney. Farmer in Lincoln County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Lincoln County in 1850. Circuit court clerk in Stanford, Lincoln County, Kentucky, in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in Stanford in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lincoln County, District 1, p. 242A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Lincoln County, District 1.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Lincoln County, Stanford, p. 338B.
"George H. McKinney (1818-1899)," Find A Grave, Memorial 81020081, accessed June 23, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/81020081.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1911-1965), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 7017516, Jefferson County Deaths.
